What are monitor apps?

Monitor apps are Node.js application modules you write that contain everything needed to monitor your application or module. This can include, but isn't limited to:

  • Probes - software components that inspect and expose information pertinent to your application
  • Views - Custom HTML visualizations that run as components in the monitor-dashboard. There are no restrictions to the HTML, so it can include custom CSS, input controls, images, svg, whatever you need to strut your stuff.
  • Pages - A home page and sub pages can be included to give your app a face, and show others how to get the most from your work
  • Tours - Include them so others can see your pages as a slide show.
  • NPM Packaging - Monitor apps are built to be published to npm and installed either as dependencies of your npm module, or as standalone packages.
